author: Kevin Woodford
method: Heat a griddle pan until smoking. Place the steak medallions on the pan and cook for 1 minute on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Remove from the pan, set aside and let rest in a warm place for five minutes. For the sauce, place the Guinness in a small pan and bring to the boil. Let it reduce by ¾. Add the sugar and vinegar and stir well. Serve the steak with the sauce poured over it.
ingredients: 250g/8¾oz rump steak, cut into medallions,  1 bottle of Guinness, or any other stout,  1 tsp brown sugar,  1 tsp balsamic vinegar
